content.question:
The histogram below represents data obtained after the census of an entire population was conducted.

The sampling distribution of the sample mean based on samples of size 2 for the population was simulated, and a histogram of the results was produced. Which of the following histograms is most likely the histogram of that sampling distribution?

choices.label: Choice A is a histogram with five tick marks on the vertical axis above the horizontal axis and eight tick marks on the horizontal axis from 0 to 0.91 in increments of 0.13. In choice A, the bars are up to the fifth tick mark at the ends and go smoothly and symmetrically down to nearly zero on the center.

Choice B is a histogram with five tick marks on the vertical axis above the horizontal axis and eight tick marks on the horizontal axis from 0 to 0.91 in increments of 0.13. In choice B, the bars start near 0 at the ends, come up smoothly to two symmetric peaks up to the fifth tick mark around 0.15 and 0.8, and decrease back down below the first tick mark in the center.

Choice C is a histogram with five tick marks on the vertical axis above the horizontal axis and eight tick marks on the horizontal axis from 0 to 0.91 in increments of 0.13. In choice C, the bars start near 0 at the ends, come up smoothly to two symmetric peaks up to the first tick mark around 0.1 and 0.9, decrease back down below the first tick mark around 75 and 0.25, and then increase to one large peak up to the fifth tick mark in the center around 0.5.

Choice D is a histogram with five tick marks on the vertical axis above the horizontal axis and eight tick marks on the horizontal axis from 0 to 0.91 in increments of 0.13. In choice D, the bars start near 0 at the ends, come up smoothly to two symmetric peaks up to the first tick mark around 0.1 and 0.9, decrease back down below the first tick mark around 0.8 and 0.2, increase to two symmetric peaks up to the fourth tick mark around 0.4 and 0.6, and go back down below the first tick mark in the center.

Choice E is a histogram with five tick marks on the vertical axis above the horizontal axis and eight tick marks on the horizontal axis from 0 to 0.91 in increments of 0.13. In choice E, the bars start near 0 at the ends and come up smoothly to one peak up to the fourth tick mark in the center.

content.answer: Choice C is a histogram with five tick marks on the vertical axis above the horizontal axis and eight tick marks on the horizontal axis from 0 to 0.91 in increments of 0.13. In choice C, the bars start near 0 at the ends, come up smoothly to two symmetric peaks up to the first tick mark around 0.1 and 0.9, decrease back down below the first tick mark around 75 and 0.25, and then increase to one large peak up to the fifth tick mark in the center around 0.5.
